title: MoparMiningLLC
author: MoparMiningLLC
created_time: September 07, 2023, 01:10:47 AMLast edit: January 22, 2025, 02:36:24 AM by MoparMiningLLC
content: I have received for sale the following Supreme BTC coin/chip sets for the purpose of selling here on the forums.3 coin sets - set numbers: 32, 61, 64, 71, 72, 73, 77 and 86 (sets will be be crossed out as sold)There were a total of 100 sets made. They are DIY and do include holograms.6 chip sets - these are also DIY and also include holograms.PRICE:3 coin set .008 BTC6 chip set .003 BTCPAYMENT: Bitcoin and to the following address: bc1qph0878erckpquc7lxjuhkcn27er5mfwq8yamh2be sure to post or pm me your txn id.SHIPPING: can be direct or I can hodl to consolidate with possible future buys or I can hand off to minerjones - just let me know!If you want it shipped direct, get with me first so I can generate the shipping charges and then only one pymt is needed.

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Mopar - BTC sent for a set of each. THANK YOUAlso, I have a question for everyone about the Load N Go Chips. The way I have interpreted the somewhat unclear Supreme info is that there was a Gen 1 Red Load N Go chip. Then soon after there were 5 colors that were Gen 2 including another slightly different red. All the chips in this picture have Gen 1 on them. So, maybe it doesn't matter but how do you distinguish the two reds. Would love it if you have any insight.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.created_time: September 07, 2023, 05:01:40 AMLast edit: September 07, 2023, 10:58:42 AM by MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on September 07, 2023, 04:40:09 AMMopar - BTC sent for a set of each. THANK YOUAlso, I have a question for everyone about the Load N Go Chips. The way I have interpreted the somewhat unclear Supreme info is that there was a Gen 1 Red Load N Go chip. Then soon after there were 5 colors that were Gen 2 including another slightly different red. All the chips in this picture have Gen 1 on them. So, maybe it doesn't matter but how do you distinguish the two reds. Would love it if you have any insight.  if you look at the 2 reds - look at the edges - you will see the difference, one has 3 hashes - which matches the other 4 chips for the 5 chip set. the other red will have 8 hashes and will not match the other chips.The one with 8 hashes will also say “Est 2016” while the one with 3 will have a simple “2017”hope that answers.
